website_summaries.verdict: Simple, effective, and cost-efficient for two half-sheet mats.
pros: Mats transfer heat evenly and release food easily
Rated for temperatures of up to 480ºF
Well-made and reliable for the money
cons: Should keep rolled or flat, as bending them will permanently crease them

customer_reviews.title: As others report, these are substandard products. Both ...
customer_reviews.text: As others report, these are substandard products. Both of mine have discolored and become ineffective after use at 350 for making English muffins. The last batch stuck badly, and the silicone appears to be permanently transferred to the high-end half-sheet baking pans. See attached photos. These mats worked only briefly before deteriorating and ruining a baking project.
customer_reviews.author: GLV

customer_reviews.title: Better cookies
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think it would make a difference to use this mat or to use parchment paper. I was wrong. These make all the difference in the world. I’ve made the same recipe for years and when I tried these mats the cookies actually came out better! Crunchy on the outside - soft on the inside. Would definately recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Bell

customer_reviews.title: This product is GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This product is Great, oh that is the title too, because we absolutely love this product. This belongs in every kitchen. Replaces parchment paper, aluminum foil, and non-stick sprays. Should have bought these years ago. We roll them up and keep them in an empty aluminum foil box.
customer_reviews.author: David Prokity

customer_reviews.title: Strong chemical smell and smoke
customer_reviews.text: Putting up one extra star not for the product but for AMAZON'S Customer Service....always makes things right. Thank you AMAZON. Not sure I will use these. I washed with soapy water as suggested. Put in the oven to broil something and it literally was smoking with a strong, strong chemical smell. I didn't see in the instructions that you couldn't use it to broil. And even so that chemical smell must be present when you bake. Now I am scared to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn C.

customer_reviews.title: Melting and Smoke on 2nd Pad
customer_reviews.text: I was happy using the mat at 400 degrees, so I though I would try out the second mat. On FIRST use it beaded up some chemical all over the mat and smoked in one area at 400 degrees. As someone mentioned it is a quality control issue. Do not buy these until the problem is addressed.
customer_reviews.author: E. P.

customer_reviews.title: Even heat distribution and keeps cookies from burning on bottom, but difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: These mats work well in the way that cookies come out evenly baked and that they’re reusable. I’ve had a difficult time getting them to come completely clean, though. Butter residue appears to come off with cleaning, but I always find residual greasiness when I pull them out of storage. I’ve tried placing Dawn dish soap directly into the mats and allowing them to sit for a few seconds before scrubbing, I’ve tried letting them soak in soapy water. I’ve tried gently using the rough side of a scrubby sponge (gentle/pink style, so not too rough). I even tried using citrus juice to help cut the residue. Nothing gets it to go away completely.
customer_reviews.author: Zon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stained After First Use
customer_reviews.text: We just used these mats for the first time and followed the instructions that come with them. We didn't use any sauces or oils and they are already stained! We tried scrubbing and soaking the mat, but nothing has gotten the stains out. This clearly reflects the quality of the product. We were really looking forward to these mats, but are very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Collins

customer_reviews.title: May be fine for baking, but disappointing overall
customer_reviews.text: I must agree with other reviewers about these not holding up under higher temps- 375 is the highest you can go without these smoking. And yes- that burnt chemical smell (and probably particulate) does transfer to the food. These are advertised as a great replacement for aluminum foil, but that wasn’t the case. These might be ok for baking cookies or things without a lot of running juices or sauces- because those do seep under the mat. And they aren’t the easiest to clean. They seem to hold on to baked-on grease in particular- even through my dishwasher’s power blast cycle. More trouble than they were worth- ended up trashing.
customer_reviews.author: No, really!

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to aluminum foil or spray, but other brands are better.
customer_reviews.text: These are so much better than trying to use parchment or aluminum foil. That being said, these don't work as well as the silpat brand. I've used mine for less than a year and will need to replace soon; by that I mean they are incredibly stained and unwashable (the oil spots don't come off) much sooner than my silpat.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to get these?
customer_reviews.text: As a parchment paper user, I thought these were an unnecessary expense. Boy was I wrong! In addition to the qualities everyone loves (such as easy cleaning), they help distribute the heat more evenly, and when used without a pan, make my homemade crackers cook faster and brown on both top and bottom. The quick cleanup after use is great, and I'll be saving money, too, since these will pay for themselves pretty quickly. I suggest you give them a quick run in the oven before using, because they do give off an odor on first use.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. B. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: 6 month review...
customer_reviews.text: Product is still in excellent condition! We really put them through the test during the holidays! Multiple uses in the same day and they work just as good as the first day! No stains, no leftover burn marks! No crackling. I was worried at first because of some reviews I've read BUT if you follow the directions and use them as they are intended to be used .. perfect product! I've always enjoyed AmazonBasics products! Same quality as name brand and less on your wallet! Than you again for making an outstanding product!
customer_reviews.author: GothicPoohBear

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE ONLY HAD THESE A COUPLE OF MONTHS.ONE IS SO STAINED, I'M ABOUT TO TOSS IT. YU NEVER SEE THIS ON TV! ITRIED EVERYTHING TO CLEAN THEM AND THEY ARE HORRIBLY STAINED WITH WHATEVERFROM THE OVEN!
customer_reviews.author: Denise R. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT REACH ADVERTISED TEMPERATURES
customer_reviews.text: On our first use of this product, we baked cookies at 350 degrees fahrenheit. The cookies came out with a disgusting plastic-y taste on BOTH mats. It may be possible that this will go away after a few uses, but after eating just one cookie and tasting that horrible taste, I have no desire to try and cook anything else with these mats. I personally believe though the mats we received are defective and won't go away. We noticed that some parts of the mat bled more of the plastic-y taste than other parts, but still, all parts of the mat left silicone taste in the cookies. This product was a total fail in mine and my husband's opinion.
customer_reviews.author: SARR

customer_reviews.title: No problems whatsoever!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what other reviewers are doing to their mats to make them look burnt and discolored, but mine worked beautifully. I bought these to save on aluminum foil. Just used them for the first time today to bake french fries and breaded chicken tenders. They were in a 450 degee oven for at least 45 minutes. They came out looking exactly the way they did when they went in. They were super easy to clean, just washed them in the sink with soap and water then toweled dried them. I love them. So glad I got them!
customer_reviews.author: MyKidsAreSilly

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These were very disappointing. Melted with first use, and they were used under recommended heat setting. Amazon reimbursed us, but I was really hoping for a great baking mat.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: SMOKES WHEN FIRST USE......
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT USE THEM ON THE FIRST RUN...... There is a lot of smoke when used so what I did was run Mat at 425 deg. for 30-45 minuets to kill the smoke problem. After that there was no more smoke coming out from those mats. So to me they were ready to regular use. But other then that. They are easy to clean and non stick so far works. Will see on the long run....... UPDATE 9-9-19 From 4 Stars to 2 Stars. They are no longer work like it should. The food stick to it so is no longer non-stick proof.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome; I bought a set for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I have now bought a set of these for my parents and my sisters. They're awesome! Nothing sticks to them and it makes cleaning up a complete breeze. I've looked for alternatives to single use items like foil, plastic wrap, ziploc baggies, parchment paper and so on. I was super happy these worked out as well as they did and I hope they come out with more sizes/shapes. I'd love it if they'd make round cake pan sized ones, some for smaller cookie sheets, and so on. Definitely a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Movieluver

customer_reviews.title: Seriously I love these things!
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life? We made cookies when we got them to test them out. OMG! They were the perfect combination of crunchy and soft. Afterward I put them in the dishwasher and, well no need to wash the cookie sheet. There was nothing on it. Perfect! I will be buying more of these soon. Also it was ridiculous how easy they are to clean. Everything in my kitchen would be made out of this if I could do that.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: These work so well! They have made baking and roasting 100 times easier. --> To all of those having issues with discoloring or sticking, I'm not sure what is going on there. I use these several times per week for baking or roasting vegetables and meat, and have been for months now. I frequently use them above 400 degrees. I have no staining, so signs of wear, and have never had issues with food sticking to them. I will stand by these. They are incredible and the cost is excellent. They do live up to what they claim.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great But Awkward to clean
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if I'm doing it correctly but these constantly have an oily feel to them no matter how I clean them. They work great and are very convenient. Storage is tricky because I haven't figured out what the best way is. Currently I roll them and put them in a drawer with my aluminum foil and plastic wrap. The problem is that they then will sometimes unroll enough to catch the drawer. I don't like to handle them too much just because my hands feel oily afterwards. They are convenient enough and I like the reusable-ness enough that I'm going to try to figure out how to work better with them.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie P

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this product for less than a week and have used one sheet, one time only, in a 350 degree oven for 40 minutes. This is what it looks like after that one use. Luckily I was using this to catch drips from another dish (which it clearly says it can be used for) and not to directly bake food on (which it also says you can/should do!) Total garbage, and dangerous as well. Would never recommend.
customer_reviews.author: habow

customer_reviews.title: No more waste - easy clean up - nice!
customer_reviews.text: I used a lot of parchment paper before buying these, and I always felt terrible tossing it and adding more to the waste bin, even if I used the paper 2-3 times. These silicon mats are a great replacement and do a great job of even baking and avoiding things sticking to the pan. They're easy to clean - I take the flat pan and rest the mat in the pan so I have a surface to brace it on when cleaning - and I drape them over a pan or plate in my dishrack to dry. Nice product, easy to roll up or lay flat in pans in the cabinet. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Liz F

customer_reviews.title: Great for baking
customer_reviews.text: This type of baking sheet is perfect for a half sheet pan. Baked cookies, bread, appetizers, you name it and it makes it great and hard to burn the bottom. Two minor cons are I wish it could be cut and it always feels slimey after the first use. I’ve washed it with soap and warm water, even soaked it but still feels gross. Didn’t come out of the box like that, I’ve learned to live with it. Would recommend for everyday baking to reduce consumption on parchment paper and foil. It’s not always a replacement for those liners for certain foods however.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Great for protecting surfaces from messy substances!
customer_reviews.text: These mats work great to protect a table or other surface when working with resin or other sticky, messy substances. I work with epoxy resin and use two of these mats as a work surface covering our kitchen table. I also have two at work that are used to protect our wooden workbench from the UV resin used in our DLP 3D printer. I'm sure these mats would also work well when dealing with marijuana concentrates or with other messy substances, so if you think you have a use for them don't hesitate, buy them now!
customer_reviews.author: Joe, Access3Dservices

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, do not cut on them.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for baking cookies/biscuits and for Pizza. Unfortunately I tried to cut the pizza on it directly and it cut through the material. I do have issues with the mats getting greasy after drying but that may be because I store them flat instead of rolling them. I wipe with a wet paper towel before use and it takes that grease feeling off.
customer_reviews.author: DLamb

customer_reviews.title: Durable, great for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are a great size and a wonderful price point compared to the brand name silicone mats. They work just as well and clean up just as nice. ( I have brand name as well) Just DO NOT cut anything ON these mats! 🙈
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: NOT nonstick!
customer_reviews.text: These are garbage. They are NOT non-stick! Everything sticks to them. This time when I was cleaning them, they started to peel. I am past the return window and am so sorry I didn't send them right back. I have to throw them out now....... EDIT: I am leaving my product review at 1 star, but after emailing customer support , they gave me a refund 2 months after my purchase. So 5 stars for service.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy C

customer_reviews.title: Plastic after taste
customer_reviews.text: Loved these at first but as others have said after a few uses any food I make on them tastes like plastic. I think it started after I put them in the dishwasher as it says they are dishwasher safe. The first few times I wiped them clean and no issues. In any case now they're unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla C.

customer_reviews.title: standard baking mats
customer_reviews.text: If you've used baking mats before, these are pretty standard fare. Good price. Even thickness. Good construction. If you haven't used baking mats before, they're great as a replacement for parchment paper. I use these to bake cookies. (I don't even bother using a tray ... I just put these directly on the rack.) Cookies and biscuits slide right off. Easy clean-up. Roll them up to store them (or store them with your baking sheet).
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: I will use these daily!
customer_reviews.text: I go through aluminum foil out the wazoo! This item will truly SAVE me from buying and using so much foil! Most items, such as pig-in-the -blankets would slide right off after cooking. Last night, I made bbq chick and poured the sauce and cooked right on the pad (of course I had the pad on a cooking sheet). The cooked sauce rinsed right off and I then threw on the top of my dishwasher for an additional cleaning. I would purchase this as a Mother's day gift or keep these in stock for own personal use. I have these and other fun product reviews on my Instagram @_acain33.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You need these.
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I feel like an idiot for not ordering some sooner. They make everything easier in the oven. I even use the second one to put under my son when we do crafts, since anything he glued to it will peel right off once it’s dry. I feel like cooking shows don’t tell you how easy it is to get cookies and stuff off the sheet with these because they don’t do their own dishes. But I think I know what all my family is getting for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Eisenstaedt

customer_reviews.title: amazing will buy alot
customer_reviews.text: used for 3 months to make sure there wasnt any issues, and these matts are very easy to clean after makeing 4 dozen cookies or a few pizzas or just trying to abuse them, and i cant, they are awesome in every way Perfect CLICK IF HELP FULL will buy again and would recommend to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Bears

customer_reviews.title: Made both my parents happy.
customer_reviews.text: My dad loves to cook chicken wings on a regular baking sheet and always forgets to use a little oil to keep them from sticking, much to my mother’s dismay. Got these for them while I was home for Christmas and my mother can’t stop thanking me for how well they work at keeping her from having to scrub the baking sheets while still allowing dad to make his wings just the way he likes them. I was not surprised as I have a set myself and they work really well for most applications.
customer_reviews.author: Charles K. Mobley

customer_reviews.title: Makes bake pan cleaning easy peasy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really clever invention. For years I've been using tin foil to line my baking pans, but after learning that ome aluminum gets into food when cooked in/on aluminum foil, I've decided to switch to these baking mats. They are actually superior to tin foil in other ways such as they are sturdier, and stick to the bottom of the pan (though easy to remove for cleaning). All in all, great product!
customer_reviews.author: TDB

customer_reviews.title: You NEED these in your kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Nothing sticks to these... Caramel, molten sugar, cheese, meatballs, baked hand cut french fries... nothing. These are the perfect item in your kitchen to crisp up baked food. They are a hair bit hard to clean, but it's easier to clean these than BURNT food off a huge sheet pan.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Okay.. But will be looking for better alternative
customer_reviews.text: I really like using these rather than parchment paper, especially when I am making cookies. The issue is that I feel that every time I bake with them, it smells like some weirdly sweet smell (that also smells slightly plastic-y) in the room. Not sure if these are the best health-wise for that reason. Will probably look for an alternative that doesn't seem to give off this weird scent.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: best invention ever for cooking
customer_reviews.text: these work so good. Melted cheese, sauce, crumbs just wipe right off. I use it in my toaster oven I just cut it down to size. And the other piece use it to put spoons with food residue when you're cooking to not get the counter dirty. Its lasted me over a year now. Just changes color from being in the oven. But no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: walter torres

customer_reviews.title: Holds up very well-works great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had good luck with Amazon Essentials so I took a chance on buying these in spite of a few poor rest. I’m glad I did. I use them all the time at 350 and they work very, very well. The bottom of my cookies tan perfectly and they never stick. The product has remained as perfect as the day I bought them. No burning or melting or anything. No more parchment or foil needed for regular baking. This is a terrific bargain. Update: I’ve used these continuously and they are still in mint condition. If I’m cooking in my oven I’m most likely using these. They’re great!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful addition to baking cookies! A must have!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic silicone baking mats! I always wanted to try some of these, but I was deterred by the cost in the “cookware stores”. These are a great buy @ 12.97 for two! My days of using parchment paper are over! These worked beautifully and made my Snickerdoodles turn out perfectly! Light toasted bottoms, nice even cooking. And the cookies all had a beautiful roundness to them! I will never bake cookies without them again! So easy to clean, light sudsy sponge and rinse them dry. My cookie pans were completely clean!
customer_reviews.author: s.c.moore

customer_reviews.title: WITCHCRAFT! ALIEN TECHNOLOGY!
customer_reviews.text: These things are flat out AMAZING!! Area 51 Tech combined with Eye of Newt Magic Spells!! Unearthly non-stick capability!!! Arcane heat resistance!!! I've cooked fish, rolls, even BACON on these little miracles in the oven. Literally NOTHING hurts them, and everything bakes/cooks up beautifully! About all I haven't tried is taking them outside and testing different rifle rounds against them; but I'm willing to bet they make it at least up to .308. These. Things. Are. AMAZING!!! I wish my dog was this talented.....
customer_reviews.author: J. Erskine

customer_reviews.title: Chemicals Filling the Air
customer_reviews.text: Tried the mats at 400 degrees, well below the marketed "safe up to 480 degrees" advertisement. Immediately upon opening the oven after twenty minutes my smoke detectors were activated although there was no visible smoke, but a faint chemical smell was present. The dishes I cooked had been made numerous times on parchment paper for the same duration and this never occurred. Makes me feel this product isn't safe at the advertised temperature. Going straight into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked but really hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this product works exactly as advertised. Non stick even for all kinds of bakery items. I've made cookies, garlic bread, pizza... Never sticks and works great. But this thing gets disgustingly dirty looking and is impossible to clean if you forget to wipe it off every time. My is currently unusable after about 10-12 uses because I can't get the grime off it. I've heard a few cleaning tips and tricks, I hope they work because it was very useful. But it would still annoy me to have to clean it a special way every few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonders!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these before Christmas and I normally make a ton of cookies and go through a ton of parchment paper in the process. Having these made baking so much easier. Each batch was evenly cooked and even with the cookies still somewhat soft I could pick them right up off the sheet. If I would have known how well these worked I would have bought them years ago. I would recommend them and I will be buying two more. Super easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I love these silicone mats! You don’t need to use oil when roasting your vegetables and I love it. Nothing sticks to them and they are so easy to clean. I’ve had mine for over a year and they still look brand new! Such a good product
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Rose

customer_reviews.title: Non stick but interior can stain.
customer_reviews.text: They are non stick but they get stained inside. I cooked baked potatoes rubbed with olive oil for 1 hour @ 400F on them and after I cleaned them you can see that the inner section ( with the fibers ) turned brown in spots. They did not turn brown elsewhere, only where the potatoes were. I tried soaking them in soapy water overnight but it didn't help. They are still non stick though. I've also cooked buffalo wings on them but they didn't stain them either. It seems like the oil must seep through the silicone exterior to stain the interior.
customer_reviews.author: RobertS

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bargain
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. I'm sure these things have been said many times, but they're easy to clean and they save a ton of aluminum foil and parchment paper. I bought them when my wife was going through endless holiday baking, but we find ourselves using them almost daily for other oven needs. No sign of wear after about 20 uses each, and at this price that's good enough for me. We'll readily replace them when needed. I've used a SILPAT before and can't justify the cost difference. Unless the durability tanks soon, I don't see any quality difference at all.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: These are the best
customer_reviews.text: You will not believe how well these work. they seem to clean fast when warm. I do not use scrubber on them. Just take off baked pork chops with sweet potates...(both leak and burn on the mat) put the mat in the sink and spray with water. Go eat...come back to do dishes, and use dishsoap and a rag...wipes right off. They are perfect
customer_reviews.author: Rex  Brogdale

customer_reviews.title: Can’t be used within advertised temperature range
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to use something healthier than aluminum foil as Alzheimer’s runs in my husband’s family. Unfortunately these do not stand up to the advertised temperatures. We bake things at no more than 435• F and yet there is a greasy, sticky, burnt-on food residue that will not wash off. I’ve tried many times. I’m way past the return window but would like a refund as these do not work as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Hyland

customer_reviews.title: ITS PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend has purchased these. After reading all these negative comments, i told him that its not a great idea. But after i used i realised how people typing fake negative comments about products just cuz they dont know how to use. One of them said they made muffin at 350 F and the product got bad, i used 375 F and nothing happened to mine. I LOVE LOVE THIS PRODUCT. PLEASE stop typing false comments its not fair at all. Product is very fine and nice. Thanks seller.
customer_reviews.author: ronald saunders

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Makes baking so much neater and easier. Parchment paper is just such a hassle, and can't be re-used. These clean easily, store neatly rolled up in a cardboard tube (I use an empty paper towel tube), and I love them. One thing to be aware of, though, is that it will be harder to brown the edges of cookies, because of the way these sheets distribute heat. I think for most cookies and other baked goods it wouldn't matter; but if you're doing something that needs a lacy browned edge or something, these sheets might not be fore you.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: We roast a lot of veggies and I wanted to get away from using aluminum foil so I bought these. Stuff gets baked on (especially on the outside Gray area) and you have to scrub but they’re so flimsy they floo all over the place unless you rest them on something...and I don’t like doing that because then I have to clean whatever I’ve just rested them on. I’ve tried putting them in the dishwasher but they fold over everything and keep stuff from getting cleaned. They’re more work then I thought the would be. I wish they were a bit stiffer.
customer_reviews.author: foroneaudience

customer_reviews.title: size matters
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 different-sized cookie sheets I have used with silicon mats for years, both sheets and mats being 11 inches wide. I ordered these Amazon mats as replacements, unfortunately not double-checking the width. As these Amazon mats are a little over 11.5 inches wide, they don't lie flat. I'm not using them, and intend to give them away, as otherwise I'm guessing they're fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sally G.

customer_reviews.title: I’m stupid for not buying them sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing. I can’t imagine going back to cooking without them. Nothing sticks to them (seriously)! Super easy to clean in sink or dishwasher. Incredibly durable and heat resistant. I actually forgot and had them in when I broiled something and luckily had no issue. I’ve regularly used these mats at 450-475 degrees with no problems (no rubber smells or anything). Match these with a good quality pan and rack and it will change your cooking world.
customer_reviews.author: JClaborn

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love these!!! I needed to replace the one I had before (made the huge mistake of cutting pizza on it 😅👎, don’t know what I was thinking). Anyway, the one I had before cost like $40 and that was just for one! Here I get two that work just as well and so far keeping up with the constant use very well for less than $10. No brainer really.
customer_reviews.author: MrsHReadsALot

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 and just bought 4 more. not slimey like the french brand. Have not turned brown like the french brand. Makes the best crust on what ever I am baking. Very even heating and browns like the top. Super release. and an awesome price. GREAT value. I use the smaller one in my toaster oven. easier to clean and more even cooking the the pan alone.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Must have for kitchens
customer_reviews.text: I think these work as well as the more expensive name brand. I use these for baking with the Amazon label up and cooking other foods (potatoes, meats, veggies) with the Amazon label down.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Just don't work as well as the real sil-pats
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these, especially at this price. But these are sticky to the touch, and just don't work as well as my real sil-pat. I'm a bit concerned about that stickiness too (not that the food stuck terribly), and it worries me they're ever so slightly toxic. They're going to donation.
customer_reviews.author: Northwesterner

customer_reviews.title: I use these everyday
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Perfect for everything from brussel sprouts to frozen pizzh to homemade grain-free bagels (just to give you an idea of how well they work with different types of foods and ingredients). Just remember to tell everyone in your house that you cannot cut on them. Happened twice in my house because people just haven't seen them before so they don't know! Haha. That's why this is my second pack.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU DON'T OWN THESE ADD THEM TO YOUR CART NOW!!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously one of the best things I have ever purchased on Amazon. rarely do I take out a product and think man I'm glad I bought this, but I seriously do this every single time I use them. Everything bakes better on them and cleanup...simple as rinsing them off, plus you can put them in the dishwasher on the top rack! Everyone needs these!!
customer_reviews.author: crimegirl

customer_reviews.title: BETTER than using oil, parchment paper, or aluminun foil
customer_reviews.text: Place on cookie sheet. Fill. Bake. Easily removed from baking matt when done. I made baked tofu cubes a with a marinade. The matts needed a light soaking in hot soapy water after but cleaned up easily. Tofu was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: They're sticky when they first arrive, but after a good washing they start to loosen up. I put these in the oven at 350 degrees for 5-minutes and they didn't give off any strange odors. I baked cookies on them and they came right off! The mats are wider than my largest Wilton cookie sheets, but were easy to trim down (very minute trim). All in all this is a good product at a great price. I'll likely order more at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: DDR

customer_reviews.title: Just wash before use
customer_reviews.text: Just wash it before your first use. It smoked pretty bad in our oven the first time we used it. We washed the second one before use and didn't have an issue. I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nick dechiaro

customer_reviews.title: In love.
customer_reviews.text: Where have these been all my life? I recently found out about these and boy am I glad I did. This will save you tons on foil and parchment paper. No spray needed. Wipe them clean easily. No more food sticking and eating pieces of foil!!!i baked some chocolate chip cookies on these and they turned out better than they ever had! Is this thing magic or what!?!
customer_reviews.author: Cydney

customer_reviews.title: Always a thought, but none too soon....
customer_reviews.text: Always browsing on Amazon, compiling shopping lists and the baking mats was always on there, and wasnt until recently I finally made the purchase, and just time for the Christmas baking season, and none too soon. My daughter and wife really liked not having to scrape the cookies off the baking sheet, not to say they are not good at baking tasty treats, but it happens to the best of anyone when baking. Definitely a must for anyone that likes to bake and to have in their kitchen. Cant really compare to another brand, but with the Amazon Basics really cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these. Clean up is a breeze and they take up no space in the storage category. No more scrubbing the freaking baking sheets! Only problems I have had, is that marinara sauce has added a slight orange discoloration to it. But it’s not that big of a deal to me. And then second...sometimes certain things aren’t as crunchy on the bottom side like tater tots (I just flip it half way through now to prevent this) but homemade biscuits still get some of a crunchy bottom. But I still love these things and use it every time I cook!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie S.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Useful
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about how much I would end up actually needing or using these mats, but after using them just once I love them. It's one of those things where you don't know how great it is until you actually use it. They are very easy to clean, use, and are a great price for how much use you get out of them. This is a kitchen essential. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Work For Playdoh Or For Baking
customer_reviews.text: I use these for easy playdoh clean up for the kids, and also for baking. The kids just play with playdoh on these and then when they're done it's easy to wipe off the playdoh crumbs and wash the mat. It's a silicone mat, so it's not super easy to wipe off, but it's easy enough.. When it's time to bake, they do fit on the baking sheet just fine. Good enough for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke Lark

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have these
customer_reviews.text: These things work wonders. I have had mine for 3 years and they’re still going strong and do the job perfectly. My mom has had hers for years and swears she can’t tell the difference between these and her silpat brand ones. I recently bought some for my boyfriend and sister because I believe everyone should have them:

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit either baking sheet I own, despite noted dimensions.
customer_reviews.text: I asked to return these. Even though the size on the description indicated they both would fit either one of my baking sheets it turned out they didn't. The baking sheets are different sizes but these baking mats overlapped the edges on both. Plus you have to hand wash and air dry the mats. I can see hand wash but why can't you wipe them dry? Very inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: ArtGirl

customer_reviews.title: Chemical smell won’t wash off
customer_reviews.text: These have a very strong smell (like fabric softener) from the manufacturing process. This smell WILL NOT WASH OFF. I have washed them with multiple types of dish soap and the smell won’t come off. I also attempted to cook with them in the oven, and the smell permitted a tray of roasted veggies. It’s gross.
customer_reviews.author: rhoma

customer_reviews.title: Use these mats; save money on parchment, aluminum foil and non-stick spray!
customer_reviews.text: Love these silicon baking mats, and I am thrilled that I will no longer be spending money on non-stick spray, parchment paper or aluminum foil to roast my evening vegetables! The olive oil and vegetable juices that back onto the mat washes off surprisingly easily with warm soapy water, and so far the vegetables don't stick to the mat after cooking. Best of all, I'm not ruining baking sheets by accidentally spraying non-stick spay on them and making an unremovable, sticky mess after baking. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DogMomTo2

customer_reviews.title: Has a rubber smell when baking in oven
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a while back and just had a chance to use it. Tried it a couple of time @ 400F and started to smell rubber from the oven. Without anything in the oven, the rubber mat gave out a rubbery smell. Not sure if that's safe for food. Unfortunately, I don't see a possibility of return since it was purchased a while back. Not very happy.
customer_reviews.author: David Chow

customer_reviews.title: nice browning, if you want to bake to that degree of crispness.
customer_reviews.text: I love these and wondered why I waited so long to purchase these. I use them a lot. I do find that a regular cleaning in sink with dishes and pots and pans, etc is not adequate and they remain sort of sticky. Place back in sink with heavy dose of dawn in both sides way scrub brush, takes care of it. Way worth the little extra effort. I store mine rolled up with rubber band in drawer. Really keeps everything from sticking and browns evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a kitchen needed item
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best new kitchen purchase this year!!! I highly recommend this silicone mats. Easy to clean!!! I’ve used them to bake bacon in the oven in a jelly roll pan and so easy and no mess. Cookies and any KETO recipe for pizza and cinnamon rolls. Highly recommend them. I’m going to purchase some for my kids and wedding shower gifts. THE BEST!
customer_reviews.author: Mary H.

customer_reviews.title: Save money, we use for everything
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had these for a long while now. We use them for everything. Meats, veggies, cookies. Fits our cookie sheets perfectly. Only downside is that it doesn’t stand up in the dishwasher so you have to soak the extra greasy stuff in hot water and scrub yourself. But really that’s hardly a problem when you compare to the money you save not buying foil or parchment paper. Definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Pruiett

customer_reviews.title: They work great, but they do stain
customer_reviews.text: I'd never used these before, I do like them as opposed to parchment paper which tends to burn at 400 deg. I can use them for roasting. I did find that roasting sweet potato they stained and I couldn't get them to look new again. Not a huge issue and it is common for the silicon based kitchen stuff. The light color makes things show up more.
customer_reviews.author: Erin S. Contour

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, this was my first time purchasing and using silicone mats for baking. I bought them in the hopes of preventing my cookies from spreading and cooking more evenly. I found using these to do just the opposite. The cookies spread even more than placing them directly on the pan (with cooking spray) and the bottoms browned more quickly. I'm dissappointed and will no longer use them.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean & the best bacon ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've been baking my bacon in the oven using a traditional baking rack which makes good bacon but is a nightmare to clean. These silicon baking mats were a breeze to clean and to my utter delight the bacon was absolutely perfect! (crispy and flavorful)
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing! I've bought more for gifts
customer_reviews.text: I took a shot in the dark with this purchase and so, so glad I have! I've used mine so many times already (cookies, rolls, pigs in blanket, bagel bites, mozzarella sticks, buffalo wings) and haven't come across any issues. I've been so happy with them, I've already recommended them to a bunch of friends and have bought another set of 2 to my mother and as part of a kitchen bundle for a bridal shower gift.
customer_reviews.author: KATIE

customer_reviews.title: Left stains on the mat and on the baking sheet
customer_reviews.text: I've always had a good experience with Amazon Basics products until now. I used this to bake a few days ago and then there was a series of stains that won't come off. I lifted the baking mat and saw it stained through onto my new baking sheet as well. After talking to a friend who is an expert baker, I immediately contacted Amazon to return them. UPS picked them up today. I bought a new baking sheet and will be buying a Silpat baking mat as replacement.
customer_reviews.author: sf.bayarea

customer_reviews.title: Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I love baking and was tired of buying wax paper because it’s so expensive. Tried these out very skeptically and turns out the are the best thing ever! I have used them several times, no sticking and even bake. Would totally recommend!! Only downfall is I can’t use them in cake tins or bread tins, but I think they even make them for that.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: I look like one of those memes of startled kids every time I use these. A-mazing. I mean, NOTHING sticks, what’s supposed to remain soft and chewy stays soft and chewy and what’s supposed to get crispy....finish my sentence....gets crispy. And clean up is soooo easy. Sponge and warm soapy water and drape over drainboard to drip dry. Just try to store flat or inside a cookie sheet if upright. Don’t roll up.
customer_reviews.author: SallyGB

customer_reviews.title: Easy cleanup, durable, nonstick
customer_reviews.text: These things have made baking cookies so easy. Because it's so nonstick, the cleanup is a simple shake over the sink and a wipe with a paper towel, occasionally running through the dishwasher every few weeks. It's also keeping my pans looking beautiful. No more baked on oil and other crud, and I don't even have to wash them! Fantastic product, and I would definitely recommend anyone who likes baking to get one!
customer_reviews.author: Max E

customer_reviews.title: Product deteriorate to the point it's sticky/scary to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for baking and at first, it's all good. Worked well, things slide off, no need to mess around with parchment paper etc. However, over time the product deteriorate, I then start swapping between mats. They start to darken and feels sticky now even after washing with different soap, hot/cold water. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chong Pin Lim

customer_reviews.title: Baking mats made easy...
customer_reviews.text: Just another decently produced Amazon product. The pads are large enough to fill a normal sized cookie sheet and clean up easy. My wife did complain that things don't seems to bake as quickly on the mats however. But she's also never used silicon mats...I do not know if that's a normal thing or not. Either way these seem to be pretty decent quality.
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: Second Time Buying
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these things! I've had my 2 pack set for years now and it's makes baking so easy to clean up. It's so nice to not have to buy parchment paper to only use once and throw away and same with aluminum foil. These have helped me cook oil-free at home and I don't have to worry about my food sticking like it would with other liners. I bought this second pack to gift to a friend the next time I see her so her family can cook plant-based/oil-free at home, too :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I’m trying to be more environmentally conscious and a Youtube Blogger (Jen Atkins) recommended reusable silicone sheets instead of one use parchment paper and etc. Although her husband didn’t recommend this specific brand I still wanted to try it. I regret my purchase 100%. They are SO HARD to clean and I can never get all of the staining off from whatever i cook on it. After using it once, I would clean it thoroughly but it would just stay dirty. the more I used it the more it stained and I eventually just tossed it. Don’t waste your money, buy a netter brand!
customer_reviews.author: Joey Antak

customer_reviews.title: Great to use, hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: These require quite a bit of elbow grease to get them clean, and they are never really completely clean. I need a steal wool scrubber to get them clean, but they are so floppy it drives me crazy. I have thrown them in the dishwasher with good results. Heat resistant to high temperatures, but gets discolored at above 400 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Moses

customer_reviews.title: Better than perchment paper
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Make Cloud Bread a lot, and was tired or using parchment paper, so thought I'd try these out. I have to say, I'm glad I did. For one thing, they fit my cookie sheet which makes it so much easier to place the blops of goop prior to baking, Parchment paper has to be rolled or folded to fit, and sometimes it decides to go it's own way. Any how, I don't think I went wrong with these, and think you would like them too.
customer_reviews.author: Hallie

customer_reviews.title: Essential Baker's tool!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It was worth the wait. The quality is professional grade. I am absolutely pleased with the performance of this non-stick baking mat, which I specifically purchased in order to make my own bread at home, but of course it works great for cookies, scones, toasted almonds, and even frozen pizza. Nothing sticks and nothing scorches. I like that it came in a 2-Pack. -JK
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: The ones cooked on the mats just lifted off and the mats cleaned up so easy. The sheet without the mats had to be ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to go with my cookie sheets. I recently cooked meat pies and used my cookie sheets with the mats as a liner on half and just a bare none stick pan on the ones that were left. The ones cooked on the mats just lifted off and the mats cleaned up so easy. The sheet without the mats had to be scraped with a plastic spatula and soaked for a while to get off all of the residue from the pie crust and cooking by products. I recommend the sheets they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works - But is it safe?
customer_reviews.text: The product was impressive on first use. But I was concerned that it kept setting of my fire alarm with no visible smoke in the apartment. I thought maybe it was our carbon monoxide sensor going off. Either way, I’m leery of whether this product creates fumes that are harmful to breathe or eat.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Cool smoking mats, smells funny though.
customer_reviews.text: Smoking smoking smoking. Ive tried multiple temperatures and smoking happens from 300-425 F. Very disappointed. Cannot use with serious, set off the smoke alarm, open the windows smoking.
customer_reviews.author: D K

customer_reviews.title: I’ve used more than 20 years & due to age replaced, after using them for more than 20 years
customer_reviews.text: I love these Matt’s. I have multiples of them. Had to replace a few due to age. Not purchased this brand before, but presume they will be just as good. I will say, they always feel greasy even after a good soapy scrub, but I know they’re clean an store them laying flat for the next time. I purchased this batch for our new daughter-in-Law to have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Survived my husband
customer_reviews.text: These are BAKING sheets. However my husband put ribs on it on the top rack of the broiler for 45+ minutes and this sheet survived! Did the job and more. Easy to clean and store it rolled up (for me). Trying to use less aluminum foil and this is a great alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Scarab

customer_reviews.title: Hassle free baking and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: One of my best buys of the year! I think I paid 11 dollars for 2 of these when they were on sale. I use them on half sheet baking pans and they fit great. I have had them for months and before we had them, we were using tin foil like a cave man on our pans. With these mats you can bake anything without using sprays as nothing I have cooked sticks to them. Biscuits, cookies even a salmon filet comes right off. They are super easy to clean with hot water. And they seem very durable as I've used then regularly for the past couple months and they still seem new.
customer_reviews.author: Professional Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as SILPAT
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure about the Amazon brand but have been pleasantly surprised. These replaced two of my long used SILPAT brand mats of the same size. They work just as well, and other than the logo and the edge color could have been identical on quality and durability.
customer_reviews.author: J. Romano

customer_reviews.title: Work well. some imperfections
customer_reviews.text: These are great. slightly larger than the pan I use but it seems fine. It has a few bumps in the plastic that can cause imperfections but I'm not selling my cookies so it is all fine. No other issues. Kind of wish they had a container to stow in. Overall they are great and seem to do what I want them to.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: A nightmare to clean
customer_reviews.text: Silicone is notorious for being impervious to anything sticking to it. They have to make special glue to attach it to anything. This mat breaks that rule by having literally every food residue stick to it and be impossible to clean off. I have used every type of sponge and soap,but this thing aquires a black coating of grease that never comes off. It serves its purpose as a baking mat, but I routinely leave it as the last dish to wash since I dread trying to clean it. Find a better mat, I don't recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great for baking cookies
customer_reviews.text: These mats are outstanding for baking cookies. The mats appear to prevent the cookies from burning on the bottom. I highly recommend them. I will say that I don't recommend you use them to bake anything else. I put acorn squash on the mats to bake and now my mats are stained from the squash and I can't remove the stains. Learn from my mistake!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Shopper

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Silicone, Non-Stick, Food Safe Baking Mat - Pack of 2
feature_bullets: 2 non-stick silicone baking mats for easy and convenient baking
No need for oil, cooking sprays, or parchment paper
Fits half-sheet size pans; easy to clean
Each baking mat measures approximately 11.6x16.5 inches (LxW)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars13,974 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
